title: Crochet representation of the Lobachevskian surface
authors: Isabella Estrada Reyes, Adriana Mejia Casta\~no
abstract:
Beginning the study of non-Euclidean geometries, physical models or
representations, such as crochet ones, provide a tangible portrayal of these
advanced mathematical concepts. However, their connection to local Euclidean
surfaces still needs further investigation. This work aims to explore how the
characteristics of crochet models relate to non-Euclidean concepts by providing
a parametrization of such surfaces.
